name: react-native-ide
description: Extension turning VSCode into a full-featured IDE for React Native and Expo

commands.title: Trigger home button press on the current device
Open app switcher on the current device

RadonIDE.panelLocation.description: Controls the location of the Radon IDE panel. When side-panel is selected, you can use right-click menu on the panel to move it to the secondary side panel if you wish.

RadonIDE.themeType.description: Controls the theme of the IDE panel. If you encounter any issues, please report them. And set this to 'built-in' to use the built-in theme.

RadonIDE.showDeviceFrame.description: Shows device frame in the IDE panel.

RadonIDE.inspectorExcludePattern.description: Files matching this pattern fill be excluded for the inspector jump to file functionality. This can be used if your codebase has some design system primitives that are used everywhere in your codebase and that you don't want to always get opened when using inspect functionality.

RadonIDE.stopPreviousDevices.description: When set, switching between devices will shut down the previous device instead of leaving it running in the background.

debuggers.label: Radon IDE internal debugger for React Native projects
Radon IDE internal debugger for React Native
Radon IDE internal debugger for React Native

appRoot.description: Location of the React Native application root folder relative to the workspace. This is used for monorepo type setups when the workspace root is not the root of the React Native project. The IDE extension tries to locate the React Native application root automatically, but in case it fails to do so (i.e. there are multiple applications defined in the workspace), you can use this setting to override the location.

isExpo.description: IDE tries to detect whether project uses Expo or React Native community CLI. This is needed when starting the bundler. If your project uses Expo but IDE fails to automatically detect it, you can set this parameter to `true` to force the use of Expo CLI.

env.description: Environment variables to be passed to all build/run commands that the IDE is launching.

metroConfigPath.description: Location of Metro config relative to the workspace. This is used for using custom configs for e.g. development.

expoStartArgs.description: Extra arguments to pass to Expo start command.

customBuild.description: Configuration for using custom scripts for building and fingerprinting the app.

buildCommand.description: Script used to build the app. It should build the app in debug mode and print path to the built app as a last line of its standard output.

fingerprintCommand.description: Script used to fingerprint the app. It should print workspace hash as a last line of its standard output.

buildCommand.description: Script used to build the app. It should build the app in debug mode and print path to the built app as a last line of its standard output.

fingerprintCommand.description: Script used to fingerprint the app. It should print workspace hash as a last line of its standard output.

android.description: Configuration for EAS build service for Android

profile.description: Profile used to build the app in EAS. Built app should be in debug version.

buildUUID.description: UUID of the EAS build used in `eas build:view` command. If unspecified, will use a build with matching fingerprint if available.

ios.description: Configuration for EAS build service for iOS

profile.description: Profile used to build the app in EAS. Built app should be in debug version and have '"ios.simulator": true' option set.

buildUUID.description: UUID of the EAS build used in `eas build:view` command. If unspecified, will use a build with matching fingerprint if available.

ios.description: Provides a way to customize Xcode builds for iOS

scheme.description: Scheme name (from xcode project) the IDE will use for iOS builds, defaults to xcworkspace base file name.

configuration.description: Build configuration name (from xcode project) the IDE will use for iOS builds, defaults to "Debug".

launchArguments.description: Arguments passed to the app when launching it. Note: this configuration is only applied for applications that are launched using a build and not those opened with expo deep link.

android.description: Provides a way to customize Gradle builds for Android

buildType.description: Android's build type used when building with Gradle, defaults to "debug".

productFlavor.description: Android's build product flavor used when building with Gradle, by default no flavor is used.

packageManager.description: Package manager used for the project. Available options include: npm, yarn, pnpm, bun.

preview.description: Customize the behavior of device preview

waitForAppLaunch.description: Defaults to `true`, this should only be set to `false` for brownfield setups when React Native components aren't rendered immediately after the app launches.

appRoot.description: Location of the React Native application root folder relative to the workspace. This is used for monorepo type setups when the workspace root is not the root of the React Native project. The IDE extension tries to locate the React Native application root automatically, but in case it failes to do so (i.e. there are multiple applications defined in the workspace), you can use this setting to override the location.

isExpo.description: IDE tries to detect whether project uses Expo or React Native community CLI. This is needed when starting the bundler. If your project uses Expo but IDE fails to automatically detect it, you can set this parameter to `true` to force the use of Expo CLI.

env.description: Environment variables to be passed to all build/run commands that the IDE is launching.

metroConfigPath.description: Location of Metro config relative to the workspace. This is used for using custom configs for e.g. development.

expoStartArgs.description: Extra arguments to pass to Expo start command.

ios.description: Provides a way to customize Xcode builds for iOS

scheme.description: Scheme name (from xcode project) the IDE will use for iOS builds, defaults to xcworkspace base file name.

configuration.description: Build configuration name (from xcode project) the IDE will use for iOS builds, defaults to "Debug".

launchArguments.description: Arguments passed to the app when launching it. Note: this configuration is only applied for applications that are launched using a build and not those opened with expo deep link.

android.description: Provides a way to customize Gradle builds for Android

buildType.description: Android's build type used when building with Gradle, defaults to "debug".

productFlavor.description: Android's build product flavor used when building with Gradle, by default no flavor is used.

packageManager.description: Package manager used for the project. Available options include: npm, yarn, pnpm, bun.

preview.description: Customize the behavior of device preview

waitForAppLaunch.description: Defaults to `true`, this should only be set to `false` for brownfield setups when React Native components aren't rendered immediately after the app launches.

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Radon IDE
walkthroughs.description: A full featured IDE for React Native and Expo

steps.title: Open a React Native or Expo project
steps.description:
[Open](command:workbench.action.files.openFileFolder) or create a React Native or Expo project new one.
[Open Project](command:workbench.action.files.openFileFolder)

steps.title: Open Radon IDE Panel
steps.description:
Use the __Open IDE Panel__ button in the top-right corner or run ``Radon IDE: Open IDE Panel`` command in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands). 
[Open Panel](command:RNIDE.openPanel)

steps.title: Create new device
steps.description: Use __Add iPhone__ or __Add Android__ button in the panel or use __Create new device__ button.

steps.title: Wait for your project to build and run
steps.description:
Set back and relax as building the project for the first time might take may take a longer while. Encountered an issue with a build? 
[See Troubleshooting](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/guides/troubleshooting)

steps.title: Explore features
steps.description:
Explore all the Radon IDE features on your own or see [feature highlight](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/getting-started/feature-highlight) on our website.
Take a look at our [Release Notes](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases) to learn about all the newest features and improvements in Radon IDE. 
[Open Feature Highlight](https://ide.swmansion.com/docs/getting-started/feature-highlight)

chatParticipants.name: radon
chatParticipants.description: Get up-to-date answers related to React Native

scripts.build:third-party: npm run build:redux-devtools-ui && npm run build:react-query-devtools-ui
scripts.build:extension-debug: npm run prepare:fake_editor && npm run fetch:third-party && node ./scripts/buildExtensionCode.mjs debug && npm run build:third-party
scripts.build:extension: npm run prepare:fake_editor && node ./scripts/buildExtensionCode.mjs production && npm run build:third-party
scripts.build:vscode-js-debug: cd ../vscode-js-debug && npm i && npm exec tsc && npm run compile && cp dist/src/chromehash_bg.wasm ../vscode-extension/dist/
scripts.build:debug: npm run build:extension-debug && npm run build:sim-server-debug
scripts.build:dist: npm run fetch:third-party && npm run fetch:sim-server-assets && npm run build:extension && npm run build:webview && npm run build:third-party-notice
scripts.package: rm -rf dist/* && cp ../vscode-js-debug/dist/src/chromehash_bg.wasm dist/ && npm run build:dist
scripts.test: npm run build:extension && npm run build:webview && npm run build:tests && vscode-test
scripts.preinstall: mkdir -p dist && bash ./scripts/init-submodules-if-not-present.sh ../vscode-js-debug && npm run build:vscode-js-debug
